text:
I'd like to automatically change a bunch of `foo(a, b)` into `a binop b`.
(e.g. from `union(a, b)`  into `a ∪ b`)

What do folks recommend? Is there an example using something like <https://github.com/julia-vscode/CSTParser.jl> ?

SourceWalk.jl does more or less exactly this. But it's really buggy.
And unmaintained

text:
DocumentFormat.jl seems to perform edits at the structural level of strings.

JuliaFormatter.jl seems to perform edits at the structural level of their "FST".

Is there anything that lets me go from a CST in CSTParser back to text? I asked here: <https://github.com/julia-vscode/CSTParser.jl/issues/265>

DocumentFormat.jl seems to perform edits at the structural level of strings.

JuliaFormatter.jl seems to perform edits at the structural level of their "FST".

Is there anything that lets me go from a CST in CSTParser back to text? I asked here:

text: I don't see any reason to use string-level tools for this. Why not operate on the AST?

elements.text: I don't see any reason to use string-level tools for this. Why not operate on the AST?
